title: Allow migration of unknown contenthash records
body:
We don't need to decode contenthash records in order to migrate them, we can just copy them over without understanding them.

Moved from #586

title: Allow unmigrated records to be updated without migrating them to the new registry.
body:
Some users are in a position where they cannot or should not migrate their names - particularly subdomains - to the new registry, but still need to update them. For example, tokencard have deployed wallets that have the old registry address hardcoded, which they use to look up blacklists, whitelists, and upgradeable contract addresses.

When someone wants to set the resolver or owner on a record that is not in the new registry, we should allow this by sending the transaction to the old registry address. We should also allow editing records on old resolvers if the name is not migrated.

title: remove encoding of contenthash to allow migrating unknowns
body: fixes #589

title: Handle migrating resolvers with unsupported records more gracefully
body:
At present, if someone tries to migrate a resolver with a record we don't understand - such as a contenthash record we don't know how to decode - we throw a JS error.

Two things to fix here:
 - We don't need to decode contenthash records in order to migrate them, we can just copy them over without understanding them.
 - If we encounter an error trying to migrate a record, we should catch it, explain we can't migrate that record, and offer to migrate the rest.

title: Display thumbnail of avatar listed in text records
body: Would be great to display a thumbnail (e.g. could be 300px x 300px or something similar), directly under the avatar text record field. This makes the avatar text record field more "real" in the Manager.

title: Drop down menu for choosing Content record type prefix
body:
Rather than having users type in "onion://" or "ipfs://" et al, with the options as suggested text in the text field, those prefixes should be able to be chosen from a dropdown menu (similar to text record keys), and then the user only puts the hash in the field.

This would make it simpler for users, and make it easier for us to add other Content record types in the future (e.g. ZeroNet).

title: Replace Migration warning banner on app homepage with new link
body:
New banner could read something like:
"ENS Registry Post-Migration: Important Things to Know"

And link to this:
https://medium.com/the-ethereum-name-service/ens-registry-migration-is-over-now-what-a-few-things-to-know-fb05f921872a

title: [WIP] Add Temporal support to Manager (IPFS file uploads)
body:
This PR:

- adds support to upload a file or directory to IPFS directly from the ENS app
- adds docker support for deploying

This adds an additional icon/button to the `Records Item (src/components/SingleName/ResolverAndRecords/RecordsItem.js )` component that when clicked allows the user to log in to a provider and then upload files to IPFS. Right now the only provider is [Temporal](temporal.cloud) but any provider who supports an [IPFS](https://docs.ipfs.io/reference/api/http/) can easily be added. 

Currently we are having a problem saving the login token to local storage. The problem likely stems from lines 109-110 in `src/components/IPFS/Login.js`. It is getting called but it isn't setting the token. We have tried also setting the token with `JSON.stringify()` but that didn't seem to make difference either.

I can be reached through github or on discord dc#8876

You can see this PR deployed at https://ens-app.temporal.cloud

title: Non-supported TLD warning needs fixing
body: The first message should read: ""KRED" is not currently a supported TLD." The second message should read: "We currently only support .ETH and .XYZ names. Support for future domains is planned for the future." Lastly, ENS actually does support other TLDs, namely .LUXE, .ART, .KRED, and .CLUB, and those also needed to be added to be supported in our Manager.

title: Allow registrant to transfer even when the domain is not migrate to new registry
body: so that the domain owner where the controller is set to a contract address can migrate.

title: Old resolver cannot be migrated to the resolver under new registry
body: So far we identified the case that if your resolver has "Content" (not Contenthash), the migration button is likely to fail. We are looking to solve the problem so if you encounter one of the issues, please comment your domain name (or the resolver you use) under the comment.

title: Update mock 204
Renewing for part-years gives an error
body: If I try to renew a domain for, say, 0.1 years, the app generates a renewal period with a fractional part, which then raises an exception when we try to pass it as an int to the renew function. We should do rounding here to avoid this.

title: Add WalletConnect integration
body:
This PR:

- adds option to connect to WalletConnect
- autoconnects to previously used provider on page load (if able)

depends on changes in `@ensdomains/ui` library to be able to switch providers, ensdomains/ui#51
For now uses a fork of `ui` library

You can see this PR (minus the last commit) deployed at https://plant-lead.surge.sh/

title: Tag new release
body: Address-encoder has recently been updated, so it would be great if we could get a fresh release of the manager so people can register their new multichain addresses.

title: Bump address-encoder to 0.1.3
body:
Supports the following coins

 - MONA (base58check P2PKH and P2SH, and bech32 segwit)
 - DASH (base58check P2PKH and P2SH)
 - XDAI (checksummed-hex)
 - XLM (ed25519 public key)
 - ATOM (bech32)
 - TRX (base58check)
 - NEM (base32)
 - EOS

title: Add support for ART domains
body:
Added .art to the list of supported TLDs
Displayed a list of the art records

title: ENS manager app does not allow registration of 56-char .onion addresses
body:
Plase see: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/.onion#Format

If you try to register a content record with an .onion address, it only allows you to register v2 16 char address, but it gives you an error on v3 56-char addresses and you are not allowed to proceed.

title: Registering a name  step 2 never starts, so registration is not possible ;(
body:
Brave Version 1.2.41 Chromium: 79.0.3945.88 (Official Build) (64-bit)

after "Request to register"  and  transaction confirmed, the step 2 "Wait for a minute" is not triggered and button "Request to register" is not disabled

https://etherscan.io/address/0xe418607009a22d308039834037770978e9be97fa

title: Bump handlebars from 4.1.2 to 4.5.3

labels.name: dependencies
labels.description: Pull requests that update a dependency file

body:
Bumps [handlebars](https://github.com/wycats/handlebars.js) from 4.1.2 to 4.5.3.
Changelog *Sourced from [handlebars's changelog](https://github.com/wycats/handlebars.js/blob/master/release-notes.md).* > ## v4.5.3 - November 18th, 2019 > Bugfixes: > > - fix: add "no-prototype-builtins" eslint-rule and fix all occurences - f7f05d7 > - fix: add more properties required to be enumerable - 1988878 > > Chores / Build: > - fix: use !== 0 instead of != 0 - c02b05f > - add chai and dirty-chai and sinon, for cleaner test-assertions and spies, > deprecate old assertion-methods - 93e284e, 886ba86, 0817dad, 93516a0 > > Security: > > - The properties `__proto__`, `__defineGetter__`, `__defineSetter__` and `__lookupGetter__` > have been added to the list of "properties that must be enumerable". > If a property by that name is found and not enumerable on its parent, > it will silently evaluate to `undefined`. This is done in both the compiled template and the "lookup"-helper. > This will prevent new Remote-Code-Execution exploits that have been > published recently. > > Compatibility notes: > > - Due to the security-fixes. The semantics of the templates using > `__proto__`, `__defineGetter__`, `__defineSetter__` and `__lookupGetter__` in the respect that those expression now return > `undefined` rather than their actual value from the proto. > - The semantics have not changed in cases where the properties are enumerable, as in: > > ```js > { > __proto__: 'some string' > } > ``` > > - The change may be breaking in that respect, but we still only > increase the patch-version, because the incompatible use-cases > are not intended, undocumented and far less important than fixing > Remote-Code-Execution exploits on existing systems. > > > > [Commits](https://github.com/wycats/handlebars.js/compare/v4.5.2...v4.5.3) > > ## v4.5.2 - November 13th, 2019 > # Bugfixes > > - fix: use String(field) in lookup when checking for "constructor" - d541378 > - test: add fluent API for testing Handlebars - c2ac79c > > Compatibility notes: > - no incompatibility are to be expected > ... (truncated)
Commits - [`c819c8b`](https://github.com/wycats/handlebars.js/commit/c819c8b533934d2ac18001d7eb27a3205b00c2f3) v4.5.3 - [`827c9d0`](https://github.com/wycats/handlebars.js/commit/827c9d0747bef7d7f89829779523b6b2dcf3051d) Update release notes - [`f7f05d7`](https://github.com/wycats/handlebars.js/commit/f7f05d7558e674856686b62a00cde5758f3b7a08) fix: add "no-prototype-builtins" eslint-rule and fix all occurences - [`1988878`](https://github.com/wycats/handlebars.js/commit/198887808780bbef9dba67a8af68ece091d5baa7) fix: add more properties required to be enumerable - [`886ba86`](https://github.com/wycats/handlebars.js/commit/886ba86c2f9cc71b7d99b9018fbe2d72a57085cc) test/chore: add chai/expect and sinon to "runtime"-environment - [`0817dad`](https://github.com/wycats/handlebars.js/commit/0817dad7e72c51d07f7700547d0c69aa79a4976b) test: add sinon as global variable to eslint in the specs - [`93516a0`](https://github.com/wycats/handlebars.js/commit/93516a0b07026ebd23c84fddf270a0c8b570bc59) test: add sinon.js for spies, deprecate current assertions - [`93e284e`](https://github.com/wycats/handlebars.js/commit/93e284ed9be1e38c5e6945f15af1ccd689f2ada6) chore: add chai and dirty-chai for better test assertions - [`c02b05f`](https://github.com/wycats/handlebars.js/commit/c02b05fa819f46bb66c878bebc6e8006408ebd5c) fix: use !== 0 instead of != 0 - [`8de121d`](https://github.com/wycats/handlebars.js/commit/8de121d21c88a6ab877e3a0eec9daaac483f3bf0) v4.5.2 - Additional commits viewable in [compare view](https://github.com/wycats/handlebars.js/compare/v4.1.2...v4.5.3)

[![Dependabot compatibility score](https://dependabot-badges.githubapp.com/badges/compatibility_score?dependency-name=handlebars&package-manager=npm_and_yarn&previous-version=4.1.2&new-version=4.5.3)](https://help.github.com/articles/configuring-automated-security-fixes) Dependabot will resolve any conflicts with this PR as long as you don't alter it yourself. You can also trigger a rebase manually by commenting `@dependabot rebase`. [//]: # (dependabot-automerge-start) [//]: # (dependabot-automerge-end) ---

title: Fix blockchain timing for name register
body:
Currently the timer for registering a name is using a client side timer. This makes is simpler, however sometimes the transaction fails as the register happens less than 1 min before the next block. 

One solution could be using timestamp of the block that the commit came in and make sure another block has a time `>` than that before allowing the register button to be clicked.

title: Controller can't be changed with subdomains
body:
Hi,

It never asks to validate a transaction to Metamask and the web app keeps saying "TX PENDING":

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/594556/70638422-26546480-1c39-11ea-9b57-85d9600f2047.png)

I tried it on Google Chrome and Brave, it's not working.

Cheers,
Jonathan

title: Handle blockchain state errors
body:
Currently we swallow errors when a transaction doesn't work or we can't get some specific data. We should show an error page/toast/pop up if so and show what we know about what happened.

Could be as simple as a network error with Metamask and the user can just refresh to obtain the data

title: Text record URL record should be clickable
body: @jefflau: As discussed with @Arachnid, we'd like to make the presentation of URL's a bit more prominent and, most importantly, clickable. OpenSea is using this as a way to link people to the sale for the domain, and it currently is pretty difficult for users to discover how to get there.

title: secure ipfs gateway
body:
Hello guys 👋 @makoto @Arachnid @jefflau 

I have updated the code to resolve ipfs hash trough a secure gateway.
This is a huge security improvement.

This PR has a dependency on this other PR 👇 

Everything is detailed on the other [PR](https://github.com/ensdomains/ui/pull/46)

As always thanks a lot for your time and your work!

PS : you can read more about secure ipfs in this [MetaMask PR](https://github.com/MetaMask/metamask-extension/pull/7362)

title: Migrate domain button does not display on Chrome
body:
**Actions** 
1. I follow the first 3 steps of this guide https://medium.com/the-ethereum-name-service/step-by-step-guide-to-migrating-your-eth-name-to-the-new-ens-registrar-5314431e22f2
I am using Chrome 78, with Ghosterly extension
The latest metamask is installed with the account that controls my .eth domain loaded

**Expected**
- A "migrate" button as shown in the guide

**Actual**
- No migrate button is displayed
Screenshot: https://twitter.com/theblockstalk/status/1197459860469751808

title: Fix travis builds on pull requests (#535)
body:
Trying to fix #535 in a way that cypress runs work again in travis and are recorded when possible (read: when PR is from ens-app repo) 

Changes:
- Add shell script "cypress-run.sh" that checks for presence of $CYPRESS_TOKEN before trying to record cypress
- Drop cypress:ci script in favor of cypress:run as it was just calling cypress:run anyway.

title: Travis build fails on Pull Requests from external repos
body:
This is a followup from discussion in https://github.com/ensdomains/ens-app/pull/512. 

Relevant error from travis:
```
> ens-app@1.1.9 cypress:record /home/travis/build/ensdomains/ens-app
> yarn run cypress run --record --key $CYPRESS_TOKEN
$ /home/travis/build/ensdomains/ens-app/node_modules/.bin/cypress run --record --key
  error: option `-k, --key <record-key>' argument missing
error Command failed with exit code 1.
```

The same issue is with the other pull requests currently failing to build. The variable $CYPRESS_TOKEN is not set within travis environment, so the cypress run fails.

I understand that this is intended behaviour to prevent leaking of sensitive data through travis. The secret environment variables are not available in pull requests from other repositories. See https://docs.travis-ci.com/user/pull-requests/#pull-requests-and-security-restrictions for more info:

> If your build relies on encrypted variables to run, for instance to run Selenium tests with BrowserStack or Sauce Labs, your build needs to take this into account. You won’t be able to run these tests for pull requests from external contributors.
> 
> To work around this, restrict these tests only to situations where the environment variables are available, or disable them for pull requests entirely,

I'm not sure on the best approach to fix this. Change travis configuration (and probably package.json scripts) in a way that --record option is only used on the master branch? I think it depends on the requirements you have - when do you require to record the test run and when not?

_Originally posted by @TripleSpeeder in https://github.com/ensdomains/ens-app/pull/512#issuecomment-555903250_

title: CI is deploying on PR to master and not on merge
body: CI should be triggered after the PR has been merged in

title: Add multicall support for migrating from old resolvers
body: Currently if we have an old resolver, a user has to migrate to the new resolver and manually migrate all records. We should have an interface that allows you to first migrate records and then migrate all records with the new `multicall` function on the public resolver
